definition: to be careful/to pay attention to
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to be on the alert/to keep one's eyes open

sentences.english: He had suggested that we might keep an eye open for any large or colorful spiders .
sentences.chinese: 他建议我们留心色彩艳丽或大的蜘蛛。

sentences.english: He's not really on the ball —he lets so many chances slip by.
sentences.chinese: 他确实是不留心，那么多机会都被他错过了。

sentences.english: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
sentences.chinese: 约伯阿，你要留心听，要站立思想神奇妙的作为。

sentences.english: If you're on the look-out, you automatically start to notice opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 如果你留心，你就会下意识地留意各种机会。

sentences.english: KATHERINA. If I be waspish, best beware my sting.
sentences.chinese: 我倘然是黄蜂，那么留心我的刺吧。

sentences.english: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
sentences.chinese: 众子阿，现在要听从我，留心听我口中的话。

sentences.english: Lazy and inattentive in class. Unsatisfactory results, should work harder.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰及上课不留心，各科成绩欠佳，必须加倍努力。

sentences.english: Please look what time the plane takes off.
Watching closely, you will have a feeling that she is acting.
sentences.chinese: 留心观察一下，你会感觉到她是在做戏。

sentences.english: Minor accidents could occur if you don't take precautions.
sentences.chinese: 如果不留心可能会发生一些小事故。

sentences.english: Nityagopal listened to these words attentively.
sentences.chinese: 尼塔哥帕尔留心地听着这些话。

sentences.english: So heed, here, when you awaken, what Isay.
sentences.chinese: 所有在世的人儿啊，请留心倾听我的言语。

sentences.english: Hear my voice when I call to you.
sentences.chinese: 我求告你的时候，愿你留心听我的声音。
留心看着他并且照样做。

sentences.english: Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 你要留心领受训诲，侧耳听从知识的言语。

sentences.english: But heeding the age-old advice about catching up on sleep might be more important.
sentences.chinese: 然而留心一下关于睡眠的古老忠告可能会更重要。

definition: to be mindful/to pay attention to/to take note of
to take care/to be careful
to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
to take note of/to pay attention to
cautious and timid (idiom); prudent/careful
to be careful/to take care
to take care/to look out
to remind/to call attention to/to warn of
often/constantly
to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
to remember with reverence/to bear in mind/to keep in mind
careful/attentive/cautious
to be on guard/alert/vigilance/alertness
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
lit. the eyes watch six roads and the ears listen in all directions/to be observant and alert (idiom)
pinyin: yan3 guan1 liu4 lu4 er3 ting1 ba1 fang1
